Post Japanese gravure here (remember this is a SFW board)

A gravure idol (グラビアアイドル gurabia aidoru), often abbreviated to gradol (グラドル guradoru), is a Japanese female model who primarily models on magazines, especially men's magazines, photobooks or DVDs. Gravure idols appear in a wide range of photography styles and genres. Their photos are largely aimed at male audiences with poses or activities intended to be provocative or suggestive, generally accentuated by an air of playfulness and innocence rather than aggressive sexuality. Although gravure models may sometimes wear clothing that exposes most of their body, they seldom appear fully nude.

I'll fix your problem. If you have a broad variety of tastes and likes. Doll Tournament.

Look at each manufacture and figure out which are your favorites. Open a tab of each doll you like from them one manufacturer at the time or find some customer photos you like.

Compare each doll and how you would set her up and start eliminating them down (basically which face you like of that maker ends up the best for you)

Now do this between manufacturers if some just win out over others on cuteness, features, bang per dollar, reviews, etc. (If it helps you can categorize them into things like best in anime style, semi-realistic dolls, price ranges, or small medium or milf) Now you have your best one or two in each category. You may notice a couple you keep coming back to or the ones you nut to the most, consider that for a tie breaker later if you need.

Now ask yourself what you want most out of a doll to narrow them down more. Can you be okay long term with anime face? Can you their lift weight of a larger bustier doll and change positions easily without exhausting yourself? (keep in mind their weight is very torso centered and can be weird to find where to grab as as they are soft) Do you want to be able to cosplay specific characters or fetishes? What price range can you live with for your first doll that you won't regret not spending more if you like it but also wouldn't regret spending that much if you turn out to not be as into it as you thought? Is there a better value doll close in price?

This should have you down to a couple at this point where you can decide which details matter most to you, shop for clothes that may make or break it for you, check out photos, and just sit on the idea for a month and browse pics. What you catch yourself finishing to is probably the right choice.


I'll give you sample of how I got things down myself, splitting it because long post.

>>42032995
So for me I sort of broke it down like this (probably skipping some because I looked at everything but for a general idea)

Basically I can't do the harsh bimbo western faces so any brand focused on that was out. Firedolls/WM just isn't for me. This nuked a lot of fantasy style brands too as they fall under that and just aren't where I would have wanted them.

Anime category came down to a few but I ruled out cloth and came down to Irokebijin Akane or Autome brand, but Autome was pricey enough it puts in competition with my like of Piper same for Mozu. So Akane at 90cm is light and shapely and inexpensive, good option if I wanted to spend on the low end .

Small category. MLW was a little too unknown, couple others are nice but not my thing like Momo. AXB/DXES seemed a little cheap. Zelex was nice but just liked catdolls faces more. Catdoll packed a lot of features at a still reasonable price. Light weight and feature rich at a cost I wouldn't regret too much if it turned out not for me. Some clothing options and some cosplay options, more than Iroke but less than others.

Medium size/semi-real (the Kpop start IG filter face category if you will). Piper really won out here for me because dat ass. Fudoll was a strong contender though. Piper Akira was the repeat here with a lot of cosplay options and ass for days.

Larger/Milf doll. JY really came up a lot here and holy shit do they have some nice looking ones. Starpery pushed into I could regret this price range if I'm not that into it, nice dolls though. Same for TSino/Gynoid, pretty but if I didn't want to use it every day for years I would regret that cost level. Came back to JY a lot as I like asian faces and that hip to waist ratio just gets me.

Deciding factors came down to I was willing to spend more than Irokebijin for more features and clothing options. Couldn't handle the weight/size of a JY doll (may get one if I get ripped eventually but some of theirs are nearly my size). Piper Akira and a catdoll ended up the final contenders with different levels of cosplay/clothes options I liked, weight advantages, and so on. Ultimately went with what I could carry easily for now and a slight price advantage when full of all the options I wanted (plus some options the other didn't have). Arrived better than advertised and has been nice. Enough that some runners up would be in the consideration for a second in the future but I will likely wait to see what options get added or become more common and workout a little more for that milf option.

Now that was my process so you would need your own of what matters most to you and what you personally find pretty.

com:
Advent, Day IX: Moriya Shrine Christmas Campaign Edition

Last: >>41975708

>What is this?

Era games are a group of (usually) Japanese-developed text porn games.
They're not exclusively related to the Touhou franchise, but it's one of the series with most era games.

>Games usually discussed here
eraTohoTW - Comfy Touhou dating simulator with time stop shenanigans.
eraTohoK - Tactical game about conquering Gensokyo through any (absolutely any) means.
eraMegaten - Dungeon crawler based on the Shin Megami Tensei series, with tons of characters from other series (Fate, Touhou, Madoka, etc) included.

>Links
- WIKI: https://wiki.eragames.rip/index.php/Main_Page
Guides and downloads for all era games. For TW you should get the eng-development version, eng-release is several years old.
- GIT: https://gitgud.io/era-games
Git repository that has latest official builds to any of the games, you can sometimes find more recent versions than the ones on the wiki.
- AUTO UPDATER: http://madhammer.club/files/era-updater.7z
Fetches the latest version of TW, K or Megaten from the official git, no login needed.
- TW NEODEV: https://gitgud.io/Pedy/pedy-tw/-/releases
Git repository with a version of TW that gets more frequent updates. Might introduce more bugs, though they usually get fixed on the following release.
- JAP WIKI: https://seesaawiki.jp/eraseries/
- TRANSLATOR: https://wiki.eragames.rip/index.php/Sugoi
Automatic translator which copies text straight from the game. Comes with an optional customized built-in offline model.
You can also download the latest version at:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DA8voYO62ARtORzxJUBhMWK2FWbt6Vlq/view
- BUGS?: https://wiki.eragames.rip/bugreport.php
Report them over here.

>How to play?
Run anchor.exe, japanese locale is advised so you don't run into untranslated text.
If you wish to manually update, delete old files aside the sav and dat folders to avoid any bugs.

>How can I help?
Read https://wiki.eragames.rip/index.php/Contributing for starters.
You could try your hand at translating dialogue, there are guides currently in the TW folder (in #Translation) on what to do, not sure if it that folder exists in other games.
Another guide is:
1) Download an IDE. VS Code, for example.
1a) If using VS Code, install the EraBasic addon
2) Select UTF8 encoding
3) Open the ERB files and edit them
That way you can now edit files without much trouble.
The path for files to edit is usually the ERB folder:
K: ERB/口上
TW: ERB\口上・メッセージ関連\個人口上

You can also report bugs or typos here on the thread when you see them.
If you'd like to either edit or add your own portraits, the files are located within the 'resources' folder in webp format. You can use paint.net to edit them

com:
I moved to Japan several years ago because I became interested in the country after growing up watching anime and playing Japanese games. Before I came here I read lots of stuff online about how Japan is shit or how you will never fit in or you will never be accepted etc. But honestly I have never had any problems like that. I get treated the same as anyone else. I decided before I came that I wanted citizenship so I applied as soon as I was eligible, and now when I meet new people they always assume that one of my parents is foreign due to my Japanese name (as opposed to assuming I'm foreign). It's funny because it's the exact opposite of what foreigners always told me.

I did hang out with foreigners a bit in the beginning but they were always depressed losers and it seemed like they were the masters of their own problems. I had one friend who was really into anime like I was - he lived here for one year and then left. At the time that he left he hated anime and otaku stuff. But all of his problems were caused by his refusal to learn Japanese (or at least, learn it beyond the basics). Learning Japanese isn't actually hard at all, it just takes time investment, but once you do learn Japanese it becomes easy to establish a good life here.

Why are there so many bitter losers who come here and then spread lies like that? If you didn't actually like the culture or want to learn the language then why come in the first place? In my experience, Japan lived up perfectly to the impression that I had from anime and games etc. so I love it here. This is truly paradise on Earth.

last_replies.com:
>>41931370
It's rather interesting, in that despite being a fairly minor character in the games, and 'only' a 'lesser' reality warper as far as her powers are concerned, Keine is probably one of, if not the, most important people in canon Gensokyo. She's the one keeping the gears turning and the stability of Gensokyo's faith up as high as it is.

"Those who control the present, control the past. Those who control the past, control the future."
Keine being a main teacher and guardian for the human village, has the unique placement as someone who interacts and consequently guides the children of the humans. Anon above has a serious point, about her being anti-youkai. Youkai are dangerous, and youkai and humans must remain separate for both their safety. I don't think she couldn't be friends with them, and I personally like the fanon takes occasionally of her working with them or teaching them sometimes, but I like this take the most when it is combined with the anti-youkai sentiment. not out of malus, but duty and and understanding of how the realm works, that I think an academic like Keine-Sensei would have.

The biggest reason for all of this, is the faith and fear of humanity that keeps the pocket dimension afloat. If people started becoming more accepting of youkai, and saw them as less and less magical or something to be afeared of, then the place would collapse. Keine maintains this balance by teaching humans at a young age to fear/respect/believe the creditable threats the youkai pose. This not only keeps them safer and more likely to see adulthood when surrounded by the supernatural, but also maintains a credible source for people to base their fears and superstitious perceptions from, thus maintaining the balance of the realm.

what do you guys think about this "exercise." make a 2d shape, grab a line off it. make a line from the corner to the end of the new line like in <. you'll notice that the lines begin to form pairs; keep those parallel. as you add lines, your brain will straight up just see it in 3d. the goal is to do this with seemingly normal shapes at first, and then pushing it. maybe put the stolen line really close vertically but far horizontally. push until you stop seeing the 3d. try circles and curves too. try stacking shapes and doing multiple at once. my goal was to make shapes like this my default when drawing, with the true far-off end goal being to eventually not see the shape as flat, but as a projection of a real thing that you could hold in your hand. that comes a lot later (apparently, i don't know when, i'm still working on it), but if you've never experimented with 3d on paper before, like i had, you might find it as cool as i did too.

name: Anonymous
com: Have any of you ever tried getting into Japanese religion? Shinto is a religion that sees everything as having a spirit, called kami. There is a generally accepted pantheon of gods that you can read about on wikipedia if you want but it mostly has no formalized creed. There are also many different sects of shinto who worship different kami or only worship a single kami. The general view of the world is that everything, be it a human being, an animal, a plant, an object, or a natural phenomenon has its own spirit and all are a part of nature that has to coexist. The religion largely lacks a formalized system of ethics due to not being centrally organized but it places great value on purity, which basically means being connected to nature and living in harmony with it. Worship and practice can more or less be done anywhere, as everything is a part of nature, but most people worship either at shrines in their home or in larger public shrines. One practice that also exists is to go outside during sunrise and worship the sun during sunrise. The sun godess Amaterasu is generally considered to be the highest kami in shinto, who is the kami of the sun and of heaven. I believe that Japanese culture is superior and eventually I want to move to Japan and assimilate into the culture so I already practice some of the religion. I have tried taking walks during sunrise, which forced me to get up earlier and go outside which makes me feel a lot better. A great emphasis is also placed in shinto on cleanliness and orderliness so I have begun to start my day with cleaning and have started to end my day taking a Japanese-style bath where I first shower off any dirt and then take a long warm bath afterwards. I already feel a lot better and happier doing these things. Can only recommend any fellow weebs here to go and embrace some of the more traditional parts of Japanese culture besides just enjoying Japanese entertainment (which is still very good, don't get me wrong here)

com:
I used to play pic related a lot when I was younger. I wanted to play it again but I couldn't find a download so I tracked down a disc and it came bundled with some other doujin games. I'm planning to dump them all and I was surprised that there are seemingly no dedicated archives for doujin games. But the bigger crime is that we don't have a doujin game general thread!

Similar to the Japanese tv thread, this is being posted here because most of the users who would be interested in such a thread are going to be found on /jp/, not /vg/

Doujin games are simply unlicensed games. They're basically Japanese indie games using original characters or characters from popular IP's such as anime or manga series. They are normally released at events like comiket or other doujin market events in Japan but can also be purchased from doujin shops and sometimes straight from the circle themselves. The most notable doujin game series is Touhou which has many of it's own dedicated threads.
